author: cnbc.com
title: Tutor Perini: 1Q Earnings Snapshot
text:
SYLMAR, Calif. (AP) _ Tutor Perini Corp. (TPC) on Wednesday reported a first-quarter loss of $12.1 million, after reporting a profit in the same period a year earlier.
On a per-share basis, the Sylmar, California-based company said it had a loss of 24 cents. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, came to 1 cent per share.
The results missed Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of three analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 23 cents per share.
The construction company posted revenue of $1.03 billion in the period, which also missed Street forecasts. Three analysts surveyed by Zacks expected $1.09 billion.
Tutor Perini expects full-year earnings to be $1.90 to $2.30 per share.
Tutor Perini shares have decreased 15 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Wednesday, shares hit $21.45, a fall of 24 percent in the last 12 months.
This story was generated by Automated Insights ( http://automatedinsights.com/ap ) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on TPC at https://www.zacks.com/ap/TPC
